00058 /* for keyframes and drivers */
00059 static int pyrna_struct_anim_args_parse(
00060         PointerRNA *ptr, const char *error_prefix, const char *path,
00061         const char **path_full, int *index)
00062 {
00063     const int is_idbase = RNA_struct_is_ID(ptr->type);
00064     PropertyRNA *prop;
00065     PointerRNA r_ptr;
00066 
00067     if (ptr->data == NULL) {
00068         PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError,
00069                      "%.200s this struct has no data, can't be animated",
00070                      error_prefix);
00071         return -1;
00072     }
00073 
00074     /* full paths can only be given from ID base */
00075     if (is_idbase) {
00076         int r_index = -1;
00077         if (RNA_path_resolve_full(ptr, path, &r_ptr, &prop, &r_index) == 0) {
00078             prop = NULL;
00079         }
00080         else if (r_index != -1) {
00081             PyErr_Format(PyExc_ValueError,
00082                          "%.200s path includes index, must be a separate argument",
00083                          error_prefix, path);
00084             return -1;
00085         }
00086         else if (ptr->id.data != r_ptr.id.data) {
00087             PyErr_Format(PyExc_ValueError,
00088                          "%.200s path spans ID blocks",
00089                          error_prefix, path);
00090             return -1;
00091         }
00092     }
00093     else {
00094         prop = RNA_struct_find_property(ptr, path);
00095         r_ptr = *ptr;
00096     }
00097 
00098     if (prop == NULL) {
00099         PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError,
00100                      "%.200s property \"%s\" not found",
00101                      error_prefix, path);
00102         return -1;
00103     }
00104 
00105     if (!RNA_property_animateable(&r_ptr, prop)) {
00106         PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError,
00107                      "%.200s property \"%s\" not animatable",
00108                      error_prefix, path);
00109         return -1;
00110     }
00111 
00112     if (RNA_property_array_check(prop) == 0) {
00113         if ((*index) == -1) {
00114             *index = 0;
00115         }
00116         else {
00117             PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError,
00118                          "%.200s index %d was given while property \"%s\" is not an array",
00119                          error_prefix, *index, path);
00120             return -1;
00121         }
00122     }
00123     else {
00124         int array_len = RNA_property_array_length(&r_ptr, prop);
00125         if ((*index) < -1 || (*index) >= array_len) {
00126             PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError,
00127                          "%.200s index out of range \"%s\", given %d, array length is %d",
00128                          error_prefix, path, *index, array_len);
00129             return -1;
00130         }
00131     }
00132 
00133     if (is_idbase) {
00134         *path_full = BLI_strdup(path);
00135     }
00136     else {
00137         *path_full = RNA_path_from_ID_to_property(&r_ptr, prop);
00138 
00139         if (*path_full == NULL) {
00140             PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError,
00141                          "%.200s could not make path to \"%s\"",
00142                          error_prefix, path);
00143             return -1;
00144         }
00145     }
00146 
00147     return 0;
00148 }
00149 
00150 /* internal use for insert and delete */
00151 static int pyrna_struct_keyframe_parse(
00152         PointerRNA *ptr, PyObject *args, PyObject *kw, const char *parse_str, const char *error_prefix,
00153         const char **path_full, int *index, float *cfra, const char **group_name)     /* return values */
00154 {
00155     static const char *kwlist[] = {"data_path", "index", "frame", "group", NULL};
00156     const char *path;
00157 
00158     /* note, parse_str MUST start with 's|ifs' */
00159     if (!PyArg_ParseTupleAndKeywords(args, kw, parse_str, (char **)kwlist, &path, index, cfra, group_name))
00160         return -1;
00161 
00162     if (pyrna_struct_anim_args_parse(ptr, error_prefix, path, path_full, index) < 0)
00163         return -1;
00164 
00165     if (*cfra == FLT_MAX)
00166         *cfra = CTX_data_scene(BPy_GetContext())->r.cfra;
00167 
00168     return 0; /* success */
00169 }
00170 
00171 char pyrna_struct_keyframe_insert_doc[] =
00172 ".. method:: keyframe_insert(data_path, index=-1, frame=bpy.context.scene.frame_current, group=\"\")\n"
00173 "\n"
00174 "   Insert a keyframe on the property given, adding fcurves and animation data when necessary.\n"
00175 "\n"
00176 "   :arg data_path: path to the property to key, analogous to the fcurve's data path.\n"
00177 "   :type data_path: string\n"
00178 "   :arg index: array index of the property to key. Defaults to -1 which will key all indices or a single channel if the property is not an array.\n"
00179 "   :type index: int\n"
00180 "   :arg frame: The frame on which the keyframe is inserted, defaulting to the current frame.\n"
00181 "   :type frame: float\n"
00182 "   :arg group: The name of the group the F-Curve should be added to if it doesn't exist yet.\n"
00183 "   :type group: str\n"
00184 "   :return: Success of keyframe insertion.\n"
00185 "   :rtype: boolean\n"
00186 ;
00187 PyObject *pyrna_struct_keyframe_insert(BPy_StructRNA *self, PyObject *args, PyObject *kw)
00188 {
00189     /* args, pyrna_struct_keyframe_parse handles these */
00190     const char *path_full = NULL;
00191     int index = -1;
00192     float cfra = FLT_MAX;
00193     const char *group_name = NULL;
00194 
00195     PYRNA_STRUCT_CHECK_OBJ(self);
00196 
00197     if (pyrna_struct_keyframe_parse(&self->ptr, args, kw,
00198                                     "s|ifs:bpy_struct.keyframe_insert()", "bpy_struct.keyframe_insert()",
00199                                     &path_full, &index, &cfra, &group_name) == -1)
00200     {
00201         return NULL;
00202     }
00203     else {
00204         short result;
00205         ReportList reports;
00206 
00207         BKE_reports_init(&reports, RPT_STORE);
00208 
00209         result = insert_keyframe(&reports, (ID *)self->ptr.id.data, NULL, group_name, path_full, index, cfra, 0);
00210         MEM_freeN((void *)path_full);
00211 
00212         if (BPy_reports_to_error(&reports, PyExc_RuntimeError, TRUE) == -1)
00213             return NULL;
00214 
00215         return PyBool_FromLong(result);
00216     }
00217 }

00219 char pyrna_struct_keyframe_delete_doc[] =
00220 ".. method:: keyframe_delete(data_path, index=-1, frame=bpy.context.scene.frame_current, group=\"\")\n"
00221 "\n"
00222 "   Remove a keyframe from this properties fcurve.\n"
00223 "\n"
00224 "   :arg data_path: path to the property to remove a key, analogous to the fcurve's data path.\n"
00225 "   :type data_path: string\n"
00226 "   :arg index: array index of the property to remove a key. Defaults to -1 removing all indices or a single channel if the property is not an array.\n"
00227 "   :type index: int\n"
00228 "   :arg frame: The frame on which the keyframe is deleted, defaulting to the current frame.\n"
00229 "   :type frame: float\n"
00230 "   :arg group: The name of the group the F-Curve should be added to if it doesn't exist yet.\n"
00231 "   :type group: str\n"
00232 "   :return: Success of keyframe deleation.\n"
00233 "   :rtype: boolean\n"
00234 ;
00235 PyObject *pyrna_struct_keyframe_delete(BPy_StructRNA *self, PyObject *args, PyObject *kw)
00236 {
00237     /* args, pyrna_struct_keyframe_parse handles these */
00238     const char *path_full = NULL;
00239     int index = -1;
00240     float cfra = FLT_MAX;
00241     const char *group_name = NULL;
00242 
00243     PYRNA_STRUCT_CHECK_OBJ(self);
00244 
00245     if (pyrna_struct_keyframe_parse(&self->ptr, args, kw,
00246                                     "s|ifs:bpy_struct.keyframe_delete()",
00247                                     "bpy_struct.keyframe_insert()",
00248                                     &path_full, &index, &cfra, &group_name) == -1)
00249     {
00250         return NULL;
00251     }
00252     else {
00253         short result;
00254         ReportList reports;
00255 
00256         BKE_reports_init(&reports, RPT_STORE);
00257 
00258         result = delete_keyframe(&reports, (ID *)self->ptr.id.data, NULL, group_name, path_full, index, cfra, 0);
00259         MEM_freeN((void *)path_full);
00260 
00261         if (BPy_reports_to_error(&reports, PyExc_RuntimeError, TRUE) == -1)
00262             return NULL;
00263 
00264         return PyBool_FromLong(result);
00265     }
00266 
00267 }

00269 char pyrna_struct_driver_add_doc[] =
00270 ".. method:: driver_add(path, index=-1)\n"
00271 "\n"
00272 "   Adds driver(s) to the given property\n"
00273 "\n"
00274 "   :arg path: path to the property to drive, analogous to the fcurve's data path.\n"
00275 "   :type path: string\n"
00276 "   :arg index: array index of the property drive. Defaults to -1 for all indices or a single channel if the property is not an array.\n"
00277 "   :type index: int\n"
00278 "   :return: The driver(s) added.\n"
00279 "   :rtype: :class:`bpy.types.FCurve` or list if index is -1 with an array property.\n"
00280 ;
00281 PyObject *pyrna_struct_driver_add(BPy_StructRNA *self, PyObject *args)
00282 {
00283     const char *path, *path_full;
00284     int index = -1;
00285 
00286     PYRNA_STRUCT_CHECK_OBJ(self);
00287 
00288     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "s|i:driver_add", &path, &index))
00289         return NULL;
00290 
00291     if (pyrna_struct_anim_args_parse(&self->ptr, "bpy_struct.driver_add():", path, &path_full, &index) < 0) {
00292         return NULL;
00293     }
00294     else {
00295         PyObject *ret = NULL;
00296         ReportList reports;
00297         int result;
00298 
00299         BKE_reports_init(&reports, RPT_STORE);
00300 
00301         result = ANIM_add_driver(&reports, (ID *)self->ptr.id.data, path_full, index, 0, DRIVER_TYPE_PYTHON);
00302 
00303         if (BPy_reports_to_error(&reports, PyExc_RuntimeError, TRUE) == -1)
00304             return NULL;
00305 
00306         if (result) {
00307             ID *id = self->ptr.id.data;
00308             AnimData *adt = BKE_animdata_from_id(id);
00309             FCurve *fcu;
00310 
00311             PointerRNA tptr;
00312             PyObject *item;
00313 
00314             if (index == -1) { /* all, use a list */
00315                 int i = 0;
00316                 ret = PyList_New(0);
00317                 while ((fcu = list_find_fcurve(&adt->drivers, path_full, i++))) {
00318                     RNA_pointer_create(id, &RNA_FCurve, fcu, &tptr);
00319                     item = pyrna_struct_CreatePyObject(&tptr);
00320                     PyList_Append(ret, item);
00321                     Py_DECREF(item);
00322                 }
00323             }
00324             else {
00325                 fcu = list_find_fcurve(&adt->drivers, path_full, index);
00326                 RNA_pointer_create(id, &RNA_FCurve, fcu, &tptr);
00327                 ret = pyrna_struct_CreatePyObject(&tptr);
00328             }
00329             
00330             WM_event_add_notifier(BPy_GetContext(), NC_ANIMATION | ND_FCURVES_ORDER, NULL);
00331         }
00332         else {
00333             /* XXX, should be handled by reports, */
00334             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError, "bpy_struct.driver_add(): failed because of an internal error");
00335             return NULL;
00336         }
00337 
00338         MEM_freeN((void *)path_full);
00339 
00340         return ret;
00341     }
00342 }

00345 char pyrna_struct_driver_remove_doc[] =
00346 ".. method:: driver_remove(path, index=-1)\n"
00347 "\n"
00348 "   Remove driver(s) from the given property\n"
00349 "\n"
00350 "   :arg path: path to the property to drive, analogous to the fcurve's data path.\n"
00351 "   :type path: string\n"
00352 "   :arg index: array index of the property drive. Defaults to -1 for all indices or a single channel if the property is not an array.\n"
00353 "   :type index: int\n"
00354 "   :return: Success of driver removal.\n"
00355 "   :rtype: boolean\n"
00356 ;
00357 PyObject *pyrna_struct_driver_remove(BPy_StructRNA *self, PyObject *args)
00358 {
00359     const char *path, *path_full;
00360     int index = -1;
00361 
00362     PYRNA_STRUCT_CHECK_OBJ(self);
00363 
00364     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "s|i:driver_remove", &path, &index))
00365         return NULL;
00366 
00367     if (pyrna_struct_anim_args_parse(&self->ptr, "bpy_struct.driver_remove():", path, &path_full, &index) < 0) {
00368         return NULL;
00369     }
00370     else {
00371         short result;
00372         ReportList reports;
00373 
00374         BKE_reports_init(&reports, RPT_STORE);
00375 
00376         result = ANIM_remove_driver(&reports, (ID *)self->ptr.id.data, path_full, index, 0);
00377 
00378         MEM_freeN((void *)path_full);
00379 
00380         if (BPy_reports_to_error(&reports, PyExc_RuntimeError, TRUE) == -1)
00381             return NULL;
00382         
00383         WM_event_add_notifier(BPy_GetContext(), NC_ANIMATION | ND_FCURVES_ORDER, NULL);
00384 
00385         return PyBool_FromLong(result);
00386     }
00387 }
